title: Quick Gameplay Thoughts: October 19
body:
Hi folks,
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Usual Disclaimers**

These posts will often contain talk about future work we're doing, or planning to do, that isn't yet guaranteed to ship. The nature of the work could change or, depending on what we discover, projects mentioned may get delayed or even stopped. If you'd like to see a Tweet whenever a new one of these posts goes up: https://twitter.com/RiotMeddler
----------------------------------------------------------------------------      
**Some non 'gameplay' content in these posts**

As you might have noticed I've started adding a wider variety of content into these posts occasionally, in addition to talking about core gameplay topics like champion balance, items, the jungle etc. Recent examples include things like how we explored new VO for Miss Fortune, or how the popularity of different queues compares. That broadening is due to a few things.

1. Wider topics like that seem to be of interest to a lot of players. I know some people aren't interested in them, but many are.
2. There are some times of the year where there's just not that much gameplay wise to talk about. Right now for example patch to patch change is fairly low given we're focused on preseason development and Worlds is going on. We've already talked about preseason in some detail. We do still want to take the time to communicate with you folks though, so shifting focus a bit makes sense as a result.
3. My role at Riot's changed since I started these posts. In particular I'm now better able to talk about some things that I didn't have enough context on previously to talk about confidently. There's still a lot of stuff I'm not the right person to cover (when is X champion getting a skin, can you unban my account, what's up with server maintenance etc). I'd like to share wider info as well that isn't just gameplay when I can when it feels like it might be of interest though.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------    
**Preseason changes and the PBE**

Preseason changes will be on the PBE for longer the just the usual 2 week patch cycle. More details on that, and a run through of a lot of the changes, including many of the harder to spot numbers, next week. Changes are coming along well, still room to iterate and improve though, so feedback on them highly appreciated, especially early in their time on PBE.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------     
**Context on some 8.21 changes**

We've added, or tested, some late changes to 8.21 as you might have seen. Wanted to share context on a few of them:

* Aatrox - We looked at a couple of possible nerfs to Aatrox, both lower base MS and/or shorter ult duration. Ended up pulling both though to instead go for more testing and potentially a larger set of changes in 8.22. 
* Aurelion Sol - Taking a bit of power out, in particular making him more vulnerable early to being all in'd. Giving him a bit more regen to make his learning curve a bit less painful (newer players don't take advantage of going back to base to top up as much as they should on him, so regen is disproportionately valuable on them).
* Irelia - Wanted to cut some power from her in all contexts (lanes, skill levels, different game phases, etc). Mobility looks a bit high, so hitting her base MS by 5 as a result. One of those changes that looks very small on paper but for some champs does have a pretty meaningful impact. Will reassess once its live, see if more is needed or not, with W CD a possible second target. 
* Zac - Buffing Q damage, both base a bit and rankup. Base is aimed at giving a little more early power, rank up at reducing the discrepancy between Q as 2nd max versus 3rd max.

meddler, an important question that has been bugging me

is it ok if i spam urgotted in all chat if i kill someone as urgot?

Just personal opinion but IMO spamming anything tends to make you a bit of jerk. Saying it once would seem fine to me, repeated feels like you're trying to boast or tilt the enemy team, so kinda crosses a line. 

That's not an official Riot stance or anything though.
Urgot'cha is also funnier than Urgottee imo
Urgotta be kidding me...

Context for Ivern buffs?

And speaking of jungle supports, will jungler wards ever return?
Dude's weak overall. Putting power into a few places in his case because we don't want to push any one thing too much further. He's extremely distinct already, so sharpening him further's not a goal.

Thanks for the reply.

The ward question still stands. Tracker's Knife has been a controversal item, but are there any other attempts in the works?

Oh, sorry, forgot to answer the second half of the question somehow.

No, no plans to bring another ward item in. We think vision amount's in a pretty good spot right now, Control Ward spam in pro/high MMR possibly excepted. Not looking to add another warding item as a result.

Thoughts on him being able to normally smite as well?

As an ivern player, it feels awful to have a camp stolen and not being able to smite steal without the passive on

I feel like the amount of time needed to channel on his own champs is kinda why he's suffering quite a bit. A champ like Graves or any other top tier jg can invade and force him out, making Ivern have to channel one camp, and hope the enemy isn't at the one he's gonna channel smite.
There might be an avenue with changing his passive to make it better on his own camps, but make it slightly difficult to counterjungle (maybe lock channel smite under a level restriction like how his double buff thing is). These are ideas, and I pitched them to some people I know who loved playing Ivern, and they agreed that work on his passive is a good way to go.

Hey Meddler, could we get some statistics on the Odyssey event?

Also the client has been getting more laggy by the patch, any thoughts on fixing the client? It's EXTREMELY laggy currently.

Possibly, what sort of stats are you curious about?

Client performance is one of those outside of my expertise things, apologies. I'll pass along stuff I hear about it when I can, but won't have context on what's being worked on, what's problematic etc a lot of the time.

Did yasuo play rate, ban rate,  rate of feeding,  hate rate increase/ decrease world wide during the event?

What percentages of player base actually completed 2 aug mission and what were the most common augs taken to complete that mission?

What are the most common augs taken in general?

The least common builds that actually worked?

The most unexpected builds?

Learning experiences from this game mode?

Toxicity rate increased in that mode?

Most common champ for same champ mission?
Hmm, imagine we could dig out and share stats for some of those at least. I'll look into it, get some into an upcoming post if so.

Was there any other changes being tested for Aurelion Nerfs? I feel really sceptical about making Aurelion Sol easier to all in, especially in the early game. I play him a decent amount and I know that when your lane opponent gets in your range, you literally can't do anything unless you have flash, ult, zhonya's, or an ally who can help protect you, and it is the worst feeling ever losing because you physically can't fight your opponent at that point. I know that weakness of 'being in his zone' is crucial to his counter play against him but still, I feel like if you made his strengths weaker instead of his already glaring weakness more apparent the changes would feel better. That being said I have no idea what changes you are actually doing to him aside from the regen you mentioned above, so it might not have as negative effect as I am thinking. Thanks for doing all the work you do on league, hope you reply!

I'd be interested in knowing that too. I'm not one to just rage and call the balance team incompetent, but if they honestly believe ASol's strength in SoloQ comes from an inability to "all-in" him... that's seriously concerning.
So this means Lissandra's passive next cycle isn't there? Because you were going to call us when you were ready.

It's not next patch, no. Have been testing a change for the last couple of weeks that seems to have address the lack of reliability/appreciation though, so back on track there. Will get some details into first post of next week.

You mentioned in a previous post that you were thinking about making jungle camps spawn earlier so people don't stand around doing nothing before minions and camps spawn.  I totally understand the rationale behind this, but as a Shaco player I have to ask:  Is our favorite clown going to be compensated somehow, either in numbers or with a mini-rework of his boxes?

I completely see how the game as a whole might benefit from spawn times being earlier, but Shaco NEEDS the extra time to set up his first clear, and if camp spawns are earlier thus not allowing him to put down four boxes, his first clear is severely hindered.  The champion thus far has been balanced with his strong and/or versatile first clear in mind, and he needs the pre-spawn time to enable this, so making the proposed change could essentially gut Shaco unless he's compensated in other ways.  He already struggles enough in the early game because it's so easy to fall behind on him.

What if the boxes were changed to a "charge" system similar to other champions' traps, and upon first level-up he received two traps?  This would allow you to push the spawn times forward without gutting his first clear.

Any spoilers on what runes do you plan to modify for the preseason?

I would also like to know if there is any buff or change planned for {{champion:113}} {{champion:13}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:79}} .

Have a nice Day!
Zoe does not need and should not get buffs.

I posted this last time but I wanna re post in case you didn't see it.
Since preseason is coming up I think this would be the prefect time to finally try some changes for lane nidalee.
I want to talk about a few changes that could be made to nidalee to help her lane without affecting her jungle too hard.
First I want to say I am not asking for jungle nidalee to be removed from the game.
This is probably going to turn out as a wall of text and I apologize but this is something I feel very passionately about and I thank you for reading it.

I'll try to keep this listed so that the farther down it goes the more work/stronger the changes are.

1. Making her traps not proc from lane minions. This change doesn't give her a massive power spike in lane but it does open up more chances to trade which currently
she really lacks and is one of the huge reasons why she can't lane well. It's also something that is easy enough to play around. Maybe change her traps so they aren't invisible anymore.
This would not give jungle nidalee any power really as she wouldn't be able to just walk in lane and throw a trap down during a gank or even pre place one within a minion wave anyway.

2. Reducing her mana costs. This is another thing that really hurts her in lane. She can't sustain or throw enough spears to even try to land one.
This wouldn't affect jungle nidalee that much due to the amount of mana options she has in the jungle anyway. Even her first clear you rarely run out of mana unless you just don't know what you are doing.
this could also slightly reduce the gap in abusive nidalee players and ones just playing her randomly since good nidalee players aren't using a ton of mana anyway.

 3. Refund mana with Human Q when killing a lane minion. Any kind of refund would be a huge help for lane nidalee whether its full or half or whatever number you would decide.
This one is pretty straight forward in how it helps farming. And there really isn't anyway for it to be abused as a jungler.

4. Buffing her attack speed slightly. This helps top nidalee more than mid but it still will help them both farm easier/safer.
this could be slightly more powerful on jungle nidalee than one might expect but she also lost the attack speed from the jungle item change awhile ago.
Now I'll talk about some bigger changes that could be made.

1. Changing her from a power farming monster to being more focused around counter jungling. This would be something like reducing her damage to jungle camps and just buffing her damage in general. This clearly helps lane nidalee since she would gain actual damage in lane.
And for jungle it creates a more clear playstyle with strengths and weaknesses. This one will probably be pretty controversial and I understand that.
As someone who has seen their own main champion have a change in gameplay.

2. This last one I'm going to talk about would require the most amount of work by far and I don't even know if riot could do it as I don't know anything about coding and what not.
Giving her 2 very clear ways of balancing both Lane nidalee and jungle nidalee separately. The idea here is to give her some type of condition that needs to be met to change the way her abilities work.
Similar to kayn. You could at the start of the gave have the player choose between two different "adaptations". Jungle adapt and Lane adapt.

Jungle adapt would make it so her passive works the way it currently does and lets her passive apply to monsters. This way no matter what changes you make to the other she has to pick the jungle one if she wants to jungle.

Lane adapt could have any number of things. Any of the things mentioned above. Auto resets back/lowered Cds/Buffed heal/buffed damage.
Maybe even reduce her damage to monsters until level 6 to make sure jungle nidalee never takes this adaptation.

This would also keep in line with her "theme" since some people don't like things "breaking lore"

The condition could also be something else. An example would be having nidalee as she currently is but if she farms X amount of lane minions before killing any jungle camps
she would adapt to lane.

Sorry for the wall of text but thank you for reading.

Hi Meddler, is there anything you can share about the Gnar work that was cancelled and how you feel about Gnar's current balance of power between Mini and Mega?

Would you consider doing a relatively simple changelist like:
**Mini:**

* Base movement speed -> 335 from 335-355

* Hyper % HP damage -> 6-12% from 6-14%

* Hyper movement speed bonus -> 30-60% from 30-75%

**Mega:**

* Boulder Toss AD ratio -> 1.3 from 1.2

* GNAR! AD ratio -> 0.5 total AD from 0.2 bonus AD

TLDR; Gnar does not need a weaker mini form, and buffing mega form won’t fix his problems. He simply doesn’t have solo carry potential anymore, even as a hyperscaling lane bully.

Gnar is not really that strong, even though he scales hard... His strengths rely heavily on his team until late game, and if your team falls behind, Gnar will not be able to carry. His range is short, and his mega form is only as impactful as your team is.

Gutting his mobility and %hp dmg will even further reduce his carry potential and make him easier to build against ({{item:3047}}). He simply won’t have enough time in mini form to do real damage.

I personally think most of his problems would be fixed with a slight range buff as mini. That would give him enough reach to do more damage on his own without getting easily popped. His %hp could then get slightly nerfed if need be, as he’d be more able to poke down tanks and may need to be managed.

This.

I'm not exactly sure why Aatrox would deserve more nerfs? He's below 48% wr in top/mid soloq, and it's not like he's dominating the pro-scene by any means of the word. You've constantly be smacking him down, trying to instill more of his power into his ultimate and now you're going to nerf his ultimate on top of all that? That not only seems unnecessary, it's almost insulting. He's more nerfed than his worlds counterpart right now and knowing the trend from balance team he's going to feel more before he gets left alone.

To think this is the same team that took their sweet time to nerf Zoe in any meaningful way is hilarious (not to mention her pending buffs that will almost certainly go through).

While I do agree aatrox doesn't really need a nerf, he's 100% P/B in worlds now, or damn near close to it. The thing is, I don't know what about him needs a nerf - his sustain has already been halved, so thats not too high, his E got the 1-charge when learning thing, his R got it's CD increased and his Q is(imo) meant to deal the damage it does - it's basically 80% of his damage. His passive is fine, and his W is also fine. He just has a good kit, idk what riot can do about that other than making changes. And he's also pretty fun to watch in pro play, seeing as how he's a very viable snowball champ(Licorice's 1v3 play was pretty cool).
